alert.note: Alert for Miami-Dade (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued June 08 at 2:25PM EDT by NWS Miami
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 415 PM EDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of South Florida, including the following county, Miami-Dade. * WHEN...Until 415 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 223 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rains have developed over the southeast metro areas of Miami-Dade County. Rainfall amounts up to 1 inch of rain has fallen during the last hour. Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are expected over the area with these heavy rains during the next hour or two. This additional rain will result in some flooding due to the ground being saturated. If the rainfall amounts increase more than forecast, then a Flash Flood Warning may be needed for this area. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Coral Gables, Black Point, Kendall, Pinecrest, Palmetto Bay, Cutler Bay, West Perrine, Richmond Heights, Goulds, Princeton, Palmetto Estates, Howard and South Miami Heights. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads. Please report flooding to your local law enforcement agency when you can do so safely.
